title: Compare average load vs. channel capacity
text:
Circuit switching works best when users transmit at steady rates and total reserved bandwidth ≤ 10 Mbps.

Packet switching is better when users send data sporadically, since they can share the link on demand.

If even the average total load exceeds the link’s capacity, neither approach performs well.
